definition: To establish a connection or establish a relationship between individuals who share a common ancestry or familial bond. This term is commonly used to describe the act of acknowledging and recognizing familial ties, typically within a genealogical or familial context.

examples.german: Ich verwandte viel Zeit auf meine Hausaufgaben.
examples.english: I spent a lot of time on my homework.

examples.german: Sie verwandten ihre Ersparnisse für den Urlaub.
examples.english: They used their savings for the vacation.

examples.german: Er verwandte seine ganze Energie auf das Training.
examples.english: He devoted all his energy to training.

examples.german: Wir verwandten alle verfügbaren Ressourcen für das Projekt.
examples.english: We utilized all available resources for the project.

examples.german: Sie verwandten ihre Kenntnisse, um das Problem zu lösen.
examples.english: They applied their knowledge to solve the problem.
